author: Paul Hannon
title: Eurozone Growth Shows Signs of Easing as Trade Conflict Looms
text:
Business activity in the eurozone slowed for the second straight month in March, a fresh indication that the economy may be losing some of its momentum after a surprisingly strong 2017. 
Those signs of a slowdown came as measures of business confidence weakened, in part because of worries over a possible trade conflict with the U.S.

The eurozone...
